alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Quay County; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 2:52PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...SNOWFALL TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MAY PRODUCE SLICK TRAVEL OVER NORTHEAST NM... An area of snow is expected to develop over far northeast NM by midnight tonight then expand southward through Saturday morning. The combination of snow with very cold temperatures will allow slick travel conditions to develop along Interstate 25 from Raton Pass to Las Vegas and along Interstate 40 between Tucumcari, Santa Rosa, and Clines Corners. U.S. 64/87 may also be impacted. One to three inches of snow is possible in these areas with the heaviest snowfall expected between midnight tonight and noon Saturday. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick roadways. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
